Leverage the internet: Even without phone networks, internet-based communication methods like video conferencing and instant messaging could still function, allowing people to communicate long-distance.
Use landlines: Although landlines are less common, they could still be used as a means of long-distance communication if phones stopped working.
Utilize radio communication: Radio communication could be used to transmit messages over long distances, similar to how radio stations broadcast audio content.
Use carrier pigeons: In a pinch, people could resort to using carrier pigeons to send messages between locations.
Use smoke signals: In a world without modern technology, people could use smoke signals to send messages over long distances.
